text: New Bedford is a city in Bristol County, Massachusetts. It is south of Boston, southeast of Providence, Rhode Island, and about east of Fall River. It is the ninth-largest city in Massachusetts. ==Well-known people from New Bedford== * Frederick Douglass, 19th century abolitionist and editor. * Quinn Sullivan, musical child prodigy ==Sister cities== * Tosashimizu, Kōchi, Japan since 1987Medeiros, Michael. "Preserving the Manjirō Legacy," South Coast Today, December 8, 2006; retrieved 2013-2-25. ==References== Category:Cities in Massachusetts Category:1640 establishments in the Thirteen Colonies Category:1640s establishments in Massachusetts
title: New Bedford, Massachusetts
